Docs.title: grid
ps: The fleXGH grid is quite simple, just think about the direction of your element on the page.
By default, every element is a column if its grid class is omitted
list: .row: If it's horizontal or has itens side by side, is a row;
.col: Otherwhise, if is vertical or has a vertical content, is a column;
.center: This class centralize the inner elements, putting space around them;
.start: This one pull the inner elements to the start. The left if it's a row. The top if it's a column;
.end: The opposite of the above, pulling the inner elements to the end. In this case the bottom in columns or the right in rows;
.strech: It's like the name, this class stretch the element to fill all the available space in his father.

Docs.title: responsive
ps: Easy setable breakpoits, just choose where you want to brak and stack everything.
For now, we have 3 sizes of breakpoints.
list: .s: breakpoint on small screens. Such as most of smartphones;
.m: breakpoint on medium screens. Like tablets and some smartphones too;
.g: breakpoint on large screens. All desktops and above.
